intro: Alpinia conferta, commonly known as the mountain ginger, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other economically important plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features tall, narrow leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Alpinia conferta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
